/work/roskilde-festival.title: Roskilde Festival - Maelle
/work/roskilde-festival.description: A poster campaign for Roskilde Festival that reframes sustainability by addressing waste and abandoned tents through bold, narrative-driven visuals aimed at young festival-goers.
h2: A poster campaign for Roskilde Festival that reframes sustainability by addressing waste and abandoned tents through bold, narrative-driven visuals aimed at young festival-goers.
p: Cutting through a visually crowded festival environment while making sustainability feel relevant, engaging, and socially driven rather than moralizing.
I created a high-impact poster series with a consistent visual system and playful, culturally resonant language that encourages peer-driven behavior change and responsible action.

/work/gare-do-oriente.title: Gare do Oriente - Maelle
/work/gare-do-oriente.description: This academic project reimagines Gare do Oriente through a full rebranding and visual communication system, emphasizing clarity, accessibility, and user experience while celebrating the station’s iconic architecture. The concept, “The Ocean: A Heritage for the Future,” draws on Portugal’s maritime legacy with ocean-inspired forms, calming blues, and coral accents.
h2: This academic project reimagines Gare do Oriente through a full rebranding and visual communication system, emphasizing clarity, accessibility, and user experience while celebrating the station’s iconic architecture. The concept, “The Ocean: A Heritage for the Future,” draws on Portugal’s maritime legacy with ocean-inspired forms, calming blues, and coral accents.
p: Rebrand Gare do Oriente as a coherent, user-centered visual identity that combines spatial design, digital interfaces, and playful interaction, reflecting flow, connection, and sustainability.

Developed a comprehensive visual system including branding, wayfinding, UX/UI, motion design, a 3D SketchUp model, and a mobile game concept promoting healthy habits and ocean awareness through location-based interaction.

/work/descarrilados.title: Descarrilados - Maelle
/work/descarrilados.description: Descarrilados is a video mapping project blending 2D and 3D animation to explore repression and resistance during Portugal’s dictatorship, marking the 50th anniversary of the Carnation Revolution.
h2: Descarrilados is a video mapping project blending 2D and 3D animation to explore repression and resistance during Portugal’s dictatorship, marking the 50th anniversary of the Carnation Revolution.
p: Conveying a complex historical narrative visually while balancing symbolism, dual animation styles, and emotional impact.
A cohesive visual experience where 2D and 3D elements merge, using recurring motifs like the butterfly to embody freedom and reflect collective struggle.

h2: Packwise is a Danish packaging company focused on sustainable, custom mono-material solutions. The project repositions the brand as a strategic partner for startups, influencers, and established companies, bridging design, sustainability, and cost-efficiency.
p: Reposition Packwise as a strategic packaging partner, highlighting sustainability, design, and cost-efficiency through custom mono-material solutions for startups, influencers, and established companies.

/work/bare-earth.title: Bare Earth - Maelle
/work/bare-earth.description: Bare Earth is grounded simplicity with a forest-born soul. A natural body care experience rooted in soil, rain, and raw elements. Crafted with forest extracts and thoughtfully simple formulas, it delivers honest, earthy nourishment that feels real, balanced, and instinctively familiar to the skin.
h2: Bare Earth is grounded simplicity with a forest-born soul. A natural body care experience rooted in soil, rain, and raw elements. Crafted with forest extracts and thoughtfully simple formulas, it delivers honest, earthy nourishment that feels real, balanced, and instinctively familiar to the skin.
p: The natural body care market is saturated with visual clichés and overstimulation. The challenge was to create a brand that feels truly grounded and elemental while maintaining a refined, premium presence.
Bare Earth embraces restraint through raw textures, muted earthy tones, and minimal typography. The result is a modern, material-led identity that feels authentic, calm, and rooted in nature.

/work/jazz-club.title: Jazz Club - Maelle
/work/jazz-club.description: Jazz Club is a streetwear brand rooted in jazz culture, blending timeless aesthetics with contemporary urban expression. Designed with intention, it embodies quiet confidence, emotional depth, and an after-hours sensibility, moving at its own pace beyond trends.
h2: Jazz Club is a streetwear brand rooted in jazz culture, blending timeless aesthetics with contemporary urban expression. Designed with intention, it embodies quiet confidence, emotional depth, and an after-hours sensibility, moving at its own pace beyond trends.
p: In a streetwear landscape dominated by noise and fast trends, the challenge was to create a brand that communicates identity and emotion without shouting, while still maintaining a strong urban presence.

Jazz Club responds with a slow, intentional approach rooted in jazz culture and after-hours energy. Through restrained design, bold yet minimal typography, and a muted visual language, the brand expresses quiet confidence, depth, and timelessness.

/work/oaten.title: Oaten - Maelle
/work/oaten.description: Oaten is a modern porridge brand that begins in the field, where whole grain oats grow under open skies and journey from soil to spoon. Rooted in the grain and the ritual of breakfast, it brings honest, steady nourishment to everyday mornings.
h2: Oaten is a modern porridge brand that begins in the field, where whole grain oats grow under open skies and journey from soil to spoon. Rooted in the grain and the ritual of breakfast, it brings honest, steady nourishment to everyday mornings.
p: A whole grain porridge brand rooted in the ritual of breakfast, connecting the journey from field to bowl through honest ingredients and grounded design.Oaten celebrates the grain itself as both origin and symbol, expressing warmth, authenticity, and everyday nourishment.

/.title: Leonor Sevinate Pinto
h2: I’m Leonor — a Lisbon based graphic designer specialized in branding and visual communication, combining creativity and strategy to deliver impactful, client-focused designs.
p: Create a free website with Framer, the website builder loved by startups, designers and agencies.

/about.title: Leonor Sevinate Pinto
h2: I’m Leonor — a Lisbon based graphic designer specializing in branding and visual communication, combining creativity and strategy to deliver impactful, client-focused designs.
p: Recently graduated in Global Design, with academic experience in Lisbon and Copenhagen, I bring an open-minded and adaptable approach to projects, always focused on clarity, consistency, and meaningful visual communication.
Designing and adapting visual content for digital and print platforms, spanning social media, editorial design, packaging, posters, and brand materials.

Developing cohesive visual identity systems that translate brand values into clear and consistent visual languages, encompassing logos, typography, color palettes, and guidelines across digital and print applications.
Designing responsive and user-centered websites that combine clear visual structure, intuitive navigation, and thoughtful interaction, ensuring a seamless experience across devices and platforms.
Creating motion and animation that enhance visual storytelling, add rhythm and meaning to design systems, and bring static elements to life across digital experiences.

Working full-time as a graphic designer at Massive Reach, creating digital and print visuals, marketing assets, and campaign materials that communicate brand messages effectively and engage diverse audiences.

Developing graphic design and visual content for Agronomia Rugby’s social media channels, creating visuals, campaign graphics, and communication assets that strengthen the club’s identity, engage the community, and reflect the spirit of the team.

Developing and managing visual communication for Agrobeja, including graphic design, visual identity applications, and digital content. The work focuses on translating the event’s agricultural, cultural, and regional values into clear, consistent, and engaging visual systems across multiple platforms.

Working as a freelance graphic designer with brands, agencies, and independent creatives to develop visual identities, design digital and print assets, and create cohesive visual systems. Projects range from brand development to editorial, and communication-driven work.
I specialize in graphic design, branding but I also include motion graphics and web design in some projects. I often combine these services for a cohesive visual approach.
Yes — I’m based in Portugal but work with clients worldwide. Most projects are handled remotely, and I adapt my process to different time zones.
I begin with a consultation to discuss your goals, audience, and creative direction. From there, I prepare a proposal with a timeline, scope, and investment.
Each project is unique, so I provide a tailored quote after learning more about your needs.
